intro: Onychium connatum, commonly known as the clustered onychium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. Onychium connatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to cool, high-altitude environments.
